skill.name: skill-creator
skill.description: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill (or update an existing skill) that extends Claude's capabilities with specialized knowledge, workflows, or tool integrations.
skill.summary: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill...
skill.author: Azeem-2

security_audit.summary: This skill contains pure documentation and local Python utility scripts for skill creation. No network calls, no external system access, and all file operations are scoped to user-provided paths. All Python code uses safe standard library functions (Path, yaml.safe_load, zipfile) with no dangerous patterns like eval(), exec(), or subprocess with shell access.

content.user_title: Create AI skills with structured templates and workflows
content.value_statement: Building skills from scratch is time-consuming and inconsistent. This skill provides a standardized process with init, validate, and package scripts to create professional AI skills with reusable scripts, references, and assets in minutes instead of hours.
actual_capabilities: Generate new skill directories with standardized templates
Validate skill structure against official specifications
Organize resources into scripts, references, and assets folders
Apply progressive disclosure design for context efficiency
Follow proven workflow and output patterns from existing skills
limitations: Does not execute user code or make network requests
Requires manual editing of generated skill content
Does not validate skill functionality or test scripts
Cannot merge or update existing skills automatically

use_cases.title: Build custom skills
use_cases.description: Create specialized skills with domain knowledge, tool integrations, and reusable workflows for specific use cases.

use_cases.title: Standardize skill patterns
use_cases.description: Establish consistent skill structures and documentation patterns across teams with built-in templates and validation.

use_cases.title: Package and distribute
use_cases.description: Convert existing workflows into distributable skills with automated packaging and quality validation.

prompt_templates.title: New skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a new skill called [skill-name] for [use-case]. Use the skill-creator workflow to initialize the skill and set up the appropriate directory structure.

prompt_templates.title: Structure review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the structure of my skill at [path]. Does it follow best practices for SKILL.md, scripts, references, and assets organization?

prompt_templates.title: Packaging
prompt_templates.prompt: Package my skill at [skill-path] into a distributable .skill file. Validate it first and report any issues.

prompt_templates.title: Pattern application
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me refactor my skill to use progressive disclosure. Move detailed reference material to separate files and update SKILL.md with conditional loading patterns.

output_examples.input: Create a new skill called document-processor for handling PDF and DOCX files
output: Generated SKILL.md with YAML frontmatter and TODO placeholders
Next: Edit SKILL.md, customize example files, run validation

best_practices: Keep SKILL.md lean under 500 lines using progressive disclosure with references/
Use scripts/ for deterministic operations that may execute without context loading
Store detailed documentation, schemas, and guides in references/ for conditional loading
Place templates, boilerplate, and output assets in assets/ for direct use without context
anti_patterns: Including README, INSTALLATION_GUIDE, or other user-facing docs in the skill
Putting all documentation in SKILL.md instead of using references/ for large content
Skipping validation before packaging resulting in malformed skills
Using high freedom instructions where specific steps improve reliability

faq.question: What tools are compatible with this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude and Claude Code. It does not require any external tools or dependencies.

faq.question: What are the size limits for skills?
faq.answer: Skill name max 64 characters, description max 1024 characters. SKILL.md body recommended under 500 lines.

faq.question: How do I integrate existing scripts?
faq.answer: Place executable scripts in the scripts/ directory. Scripts can run without loading into context for token efficiency.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using these scripts?
faq.answer: Yes. Scripts only access user-specified paths. No network calls, no system directories, no credential access.

faq.question: Why does validation fail on my skill?
faq.answer: Common issues: missing name/description in frontmatter, invalid YAML, non-hyphen-case name, angle brackets in description.

faq.question: How does this compare to other skill frameworks?
faq.answer: This skill follows Spec-Driven Development patterns. It emphasizes context efficiency, reusable resources, and standardized validation.
